alert.note: Alert for Central St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 20 at 4:39AM CDT until April 21 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Central St. Louis County. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Bois Forte Band, Lake Vermilion area. * WHEN...Until 7 AM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Freezing rain leading to ice accumulations is most likely late tonight through Thursday early afternoon, especially in the south and eastern parts of central St. Louis County. Accumulating snowfall is most likely in the northern and western parts of this same area.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
